titleStmt.title: Two ordinances of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament: the one for the enabling of the Commissioners of the Great Seale, and the other committees in their severall counties, to tender an oath to all such persons, of what degree or quality soever, that shall come into the protection of the Parliament. Together with the said oath to be taken. The other, for the discharging of the members of both Houses from all places military and civill. Die Sabbathi, 4. April.. [sic] 1645. Ordered by the Lords assembled in Parliament, that these ordinances shall be forthwith printed and published. John Brown Cler. Parliamentorum.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Iohn Wright, in the old Bayley.,

notesStmt.note: The ordinances are dated April 3 and 5, 1645.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
